abstract: InBev, the world’s biggest brewer, started to build an argument Sunday for its $65-a-share offer to acquire Anheuser-Busch, saying it was based on the Budweiser maker’s current assets and business.
lead_paragraph: InBev, the world’s biggest brewer, started to build an argument Sunday for its $65-a-share offer to acquire Anheuser-Busch, saying it was based on the Budweiser maker’s current assets and business.
